questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks (CK) is Implementing Sales Cloud and expects hundreds of new Accounts will be added into Salesforce on a daily basis. CK has an automated process to assign the Account owners. If no assignment can be made for an Account, it will be assigned to a fictitious owner and a person will manually review and re-assign it at a later date. At any given time, a fictitious owner may have more than 10,000 Account records assigned to it.

Which two solutions should the consultant recommend when CK sets up the new Account process? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Assign the Modify All Data system permission to the fictitious owner.
choices.C: Place the fictitious owner in a separate role at the top of the role hierarchy.
choices.B: Keep the fictitious owner out of public groups that could be used in sharing rules.
choices.D: Add the fictitious owner to a role at the lowest level of the role hierarchy.

choices.B: Account Roll-up Summary fields will update from the Opportunity object.
choices.A: Opportunity Roll-up summary fields will update from the opportunity Line item object.
choices.D: Account cross-object formulas always use the dynamic conversion rate for currency conversion.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to share revenue from opportunities with multiple reps. A consultant recommends using opportunity splits.

Which two prerequisites should be considered before splits are enabled? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Enable opportunity teams and add the opportunity owner as a team member.
choices.B: Transfer opportunities owned by inactive users to active users.
choices.D: Resolve any inactive currencies prior to enabling splits.
choices.A: Add customized split types before enabling splits.

CK has organization-wide default access set to Public Read/Write for Accounts. CK discovered this caused issues with data quality where reps edited Accounts outside their scope of responsibility. CK wants to allow reps to view any Account, but restrict editing to only reps who are responsible for those specific Accounts.

Which two steps should a consultant recommend to allow reps to continue to collaborate while eliminating incorrect edits? (Choose two.)
